title: Time-based One-Time Password
summary: Time-based One-time Password (TOTP) is a computer algorithm that generates a one-time password (OTP) that uses the current time as a source of uniqueness. As an extension of the HMAC-based One-time Password algorithm (HOTP), it has been adopted as Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) standard RFCÂ 6238.[1]
